title: Dhakuria (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Dhakuria (Vidhan Sabha constituency) was an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="South%2024%20Parganas%20district">South 24 Parganas district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As a consequence of the orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, Dhakuria (Vidhan Sabha constituency) ceases to exist from 2011.
It was part of <a href="Kolkata%20Dakshin%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Kolkata Dakshin (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
Election results.
1977-2006.
In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006 state assembly elections</a>, <a href="Kshiti%20Goswami">Kshiti Goswami</a> of <a href="Revolutionary%20Socialist%20Party%20%28India%29">RSP</a> won the 151 Dhakuria assembly seat defeating his nearest rival Sougata Roy of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Sougata Roy of Trinamool Congress defeated, <a href="Kshiti%20Goswami">Kshiti Goswami</a> of RSP in 2001. <a href="Kshiti%20Goswami">Kshiti Goswami</a> of RSP defeated Sukhendu Sekhar Roy of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1996 and Jatin Chakraborty, Independent, in 1991. Jatin Chakraborty of RSP defeated Shankar Kanti Bhowmick of Congress in 1987, Tushar Kanti Dasgupta of Congress in 1982 and Arabinda Prasad Dasgupta of Congress in 1977.
1967-1972.
Somnath Lahiri of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India">CPI</a> won the Dhakuria seat in 1972, 1971, 1969 and 1967. Prior to the seat did not exist.
